FractionHP.name: Hit Points Attribute Data Path
FractionHP.hint: Your system might be using another data path. If the estimate isn't showing correctly, input the data path to the correct attribute (e.g. actor.system.health).

FractionMath.name: Fraction Equation
FractionMath.hint: Your system's HP equation might be different than the default, choose the equation used to estimate the health fraction.

markDead.name: Mark as Dead
markDead.hint: Marks all the selected tokens as Dead. If all the selected tokens are already Dead, they'll be reset to alive.

customEstimates.name: Custom Estimates
customEstimates.hint: Sets custom estimates for the selected tokens. Leave it blank to reset it.

dontMarkDead.name: Don't Mark as Dead
dontMarkDead.hint: Makes NPCs to not be shown as Dead when its HP reaches 0 (e.g. it'll show Unconscious). This is only useful if you're using the {setting} setting.

hideEstimates.name: Hide Estimates
hideEstimates.hint: Hides the estimates of selected tokens from the players. Hidden estimates will show a "*" for the GM.

hideNames.name: Hide Names
hideNames.hint: Hides the names of selected tokens when you're using the {setting} setting.

hideEstimatesAndNames.name: Hide Estimates and Names
hideEstimatesAndNames.hint: Hides both the estimates and names of selected tokens.

unknownEntity.name: Unknown Entity Name
unknownEntity.hint: Sets how a hidden character shall be called.

alwaysShow.name: Always Show Estimates
alwaysShow.hint: Makes the estimates always visible instead of just when hovering over a token.

combatOnly.name: Show Only on Combat
combatOnly.hint: Shows the estimates only when a combat is active.

showDescription.name: Show Estimates: Users
showDescription.hint: Show estimates to the following users.

showDescriptionTokenType.name: Show Estimates: Tokens
showDescriptionTokenType.hint: Show estimates of the following tokens.

stateNames.name: Stages
stateNames.hint:
An array of descriptions shown to players, arranged from worst to best possible health.
The amount of possible descriptions is not limited, the module will adjust the health percentage to show them proportionally to the amount.
If there is a need for one description to cover a higher range of health than others simply copy it several times.
stateNames.default: Unconscious, Near Death, Badly Injured, Injured, Barely Injured, Uninjured

deathState.name: Death State on Condition
deathState.hint: Show token as defined on the {setting} setting when it has been affected by any condition that uses the icon set on the {setting2} setting. Works independently from the macro.

deathStateName.name: Death State Name
deathStateName.hint: The description shown to players when the token is dead. Compendium tab has a macro for marking a token (or several) as dead.

deathMarker.name: Death Marker
deathMarker.hint: Path to the condition icon that marks the dead tokens.

NPCsJustDie.name: NPCs die immediately
NPCsJustDie.hint: The last stage of NPCs is replaced by the Death State Name.

perfectionism.name: Best Stage Display
perfectionism.hint: Set how the best stage is displayed. The best stage is the last stage in the {setting1} setting. Suggestion for users that have {setting2} disabled: if you intended for each stage to be equal to one color, don't use the first choice.

choices.0: Show even when the target is damaged
choices.1: Show only when the target isn't damaged

outputChat.name: Output Estimate to Chat
outputChat.hint: Output any estimate changes to chat. Characters flagged with the Hide Estimate macro will be shown as the description of the {setting} setting.

addTemp.name: Add Temporary Health
addTemp.hint:
Include temporary health points in calculating what description to show.
E.g. with the setting turned on the token receiving temp HP will look "healthier" unless it's already at max health.

breakOnZeroMaxHP.name: Hide on tokens with 0 max HP

fontSize.name: Font Size
fontSize.hint: Accepts any valid property for CSS font-size

useColor.name: Use Color
useColor.hint: This won't affect the settings window, but with checkmark off the descriptions will be shown in black and white.

smoothGradient.name: Smooth Gradient
smoothGradient.hint: With this setting off the color will only change when the next description is reached, with it on it will reflect the health percentage.

positionAdjustment.name: Position Adjustment
positionAdjustment.hint: Position is set relative to the frame. The number lets you tweak the position relative to its normal place. Positive numbers push it higher; negative â€“ lower. The default value of -1 sets it to "1 line below initial position".

scaleToZoom.name: Scale Estimates to Zoom
scaleToZoom.hint: Scales the estimate based on the zoom distance. Caveats: {setting} won't accept the "larger" and "smaller" values, and {setting2}'s number will be ignored.

tempHP.name: Temporary Hit Points Attribute Data Path
tempHP.hint: Leave it blank if the system doesn't have one or if you don't want it to be added to the estimation.

useSystemStates.name: Use Wound States
useSystemStates.hint: Ignores the Stages setting and uses the Cyberpunk RED Core's wound states.

addNonlethal.name: Use Nonlethal Damage
addNonlethal.hint: If enabled nonlethal damage will be substracted from current health for estimation.

showExtra.name: Show {condition1} & {condition2}
showExtra.hint: Shows the {condition1} and {condition2} descriptions when their prerequisites are fulfilled.

disabledName.name: Staggered Stage
disabledName.hint: Shows when a token is precisely at 0 HP, has nonlethal damage exactly equal to its current hit points, or is affected by the Staggered condition.

dyingName.name: Unconscious Stage
dyingName.hint: Shows when a token has more nonlethal damage than HP.

staminaToHp.name: Stamina to Estimate
staminaToHp.hint: Add Stamina Points to the estimate.

useThreshold.hint: Estimates the health of Vehicles as three stages, so it is recommended to reduce the number of stages of the {setting} setting to three if you toggle this setting on.

countPools.name: Count Empty Pools
countPools.hint: Count empty pools instead of sum of their values, with the estimation only changing when a pool is depleted or replenished.

useThreshold.name: Use Vehicle Threshold
useThreshold.hint: Vehicles Use the stages set on {setting1} setting. Otherwise, vehicles will use the same description as the {setting2} setting..

thresholdNames.name: Threshold Stages
thresholdNames.hint: The amount of stages is limited to 3, arranged from worst to best condition

vehicleNames.name: Vehicle Stages
vehicleNames.hint: Descriptions shown for drones, starships and vehicles.
vehicleNames.default: Wrecked, Flaming, Smoking, Battered, Scratched, Pristine

addStamina.name: Account for Stamina
addStamina.hint: With this setting on, Stamina will be added to HP for calculations.

simpleRule.name: Estimation Rule
simpleRule.hint: The JS formula for calculating the fraction of health token has. Alter with caution. Default assumes simple descending health, e.g. you start with 10/10 in your health field and go down to 0/10 when taking damage.

vehicleNames.name: Vehicle Stages
vehicleNames.hint: Descriptions shown for starships and vehicles.
vehicleNames.default: Destroyed, Severely Damaged, Heavily Damaged, Lightly Damaged, Very Lightly Damaged, Undamaged

defaultWildCardMaxWounds.name: Default Wild Card's Max Wounds
defaultWildCardMaxWounds.hint: This is used to calculate the default max wounds a NPC flagged as Wild Card would have for estimations.

vehicleNames.name: Vehicle Stages
vehicleNames.default: Wrecked, Flaming, Smoking, Battered, Scratched, Pristine

showIncap.name: {incap} Status Effect
showIncap.hint: Tokens with the {incap} Status Effect will be shown as {incap} instead of their actual estimates. Doesn't work for tokens that are vehicles or dead.
